messages.subject: New Fic: The Manju
messages.msgSnippet: New fic. Randomness. Hope you all enjoy. --M. ... M’s guide to the Shinsengumi (Author’s note: Written on a stomach full of Chinese Food, altogether too
messages.messageBody:
New fic. Randomness. Hope you all enjoy.

--M.

-----------------------------

M�s guide to the Shinsengumi

(Author�s note: Written on a stomach full of Chinese Food, altogether too
much caffeine, and horrible pre-going to Japan jitters)

(Author's 2nd note: Inspired by Waiting for Godot, appropriately read at 2
AM)

(Star Wars Opening Theme (as played by Tokyo Kosei Wind Orchestra) plays as
a palanquin passes through a snowy street)

M: 1860. Yes, just another date in history. Today is the day that tairo Ii
Naosuke heads to Edo Castle for another rousing session of rooting out the
extremists infecting our government today. In just a few minutes� time�

(shrouded figures run past)

Shrouded figures: SONNO JOI!!

M: Right! (pulls down backdrop to reveal a chalkboard). Some would say that
this has nothing to do with the Shinsengumi. Or does it? Do manju�those oh
so delectable pounded rice cakes�have anything to do with it? Or how big one
can open their mouth?

(thinks)

M: MITOCHONDRIA!!

(enter Sec)

Sec: M, where�s that timeline?

M: Working on it!! (Hides compromising photos of Aizu Women�s Brigade)

Sec: �The Effect of Hotter-than-Wasabi Bikini-clad Naginata Masters on
Japan�s Bakumatsu Period.� HAHAHAHAAAA�.some research, eh?

M: Not much better than your �Fundoshi: A History��

Sec: Oww�.well met�

M: But we�re here to explain the Shinsengumi.

Sec: And what manju has to do with all of it.

M: But manju does have to do with it! And big mouths, too!

Sec: Nowadays even die-cast cars have to do with it.

M: But I�ll �newly select� Teruhime any day�*sparkle sparkle*

Sec: (pulls out paper fan and whacks M) The Shinsengumi!!

M: RIGHT! The Shinsengumi!

Sec: But the manju!

M: What about the manju?

Sec: That�s your line!

M: My line?

(enter Barb)

Barb: I just got some manju on Ebay!! Oh wait�it�s a manju-patterned haori.

M: Not bad, not bad�

Sec: But the fundoshiiiiii�.

M: Can we get back to the topic at hand?

Sec: Yeah, I feel like we�re waiting for Godot.

M: No, we�re waiting for Kon-do.

Barb: LOL

M: (Writes �Shinsengumi to ha nani ka?� on the board) So, back to our topic.
What is the Shinsengumi?

Sec: (looks up from Barb�s Satou Koichi fundoshi desktop) Huh? You say
something?

M: But the manju!!

Barb: Oh�hey, look at what I got today! (tosses M a big Tennen Rishin Ryu
bokken. M falls over)

Sec: You okay?

M: M�.manju�Ooh�I like it. Just the right weight for bashing in slow
computers.

(Enter MissB)

MissB: Why are you guys going on about the size of Kondou�s mouth and
th�oooooo fundoshi�..

M: Manju, anyone?

Sec: I don�t see any.

(Manju rain down from the ceiling)

Barb: Isn�t that supposed to be manna?

MissB: But we�re in Japan, after all.

(enter Phil in Sekihoutai uniform)

Phil: (catches manju in midair) Ooh, manju.

(M gets up) M: But the Shinsengumi!

Everyone else: KOICHI SATO!!! (all run offstage)

M: ����.

(Fundoshi start flying wildly from offstage)

M: And now for something completely different.

OWARI!! (The end)

messages.subject: Shinsen Ambassadors
messages.msgSnippet: That was SO Good! I loved it. I do so miss dear snarky Takeda... -- Barbara Sheridan http://www.barbarasheridan.net The Blog--
messages.messageBody:
That was SO Good! I loved it.

I do so miss dear snarky Takeda...

--
Barbara Sheridan
http://www.barbarasheridan.net
The Blog-- http://barbarasheridan.blogspot.com/

messages.subject: Re: New file uploaded to SHQ_Spy_Division
messages.msgSnippet: I always spot typos AFTER I upload stuff. Regarding Itou s jacket...I meant to simply say black silk I typed black crepe or something I wrote the fic after
messages.messageBody:
I always spot typos AFTER I upload stuff.
Regarding Itou's jacket...I meant to simply say "black silk" I typed
"black crepe" or something

I wrote the fic after reading that Tommy had at one point took the
hand of a young lady, drew her close and kissed her (^_^)...Tommy was
17-18 he sure was BOLD...so the fic does not have that historical
episode...but I think Hijikata would've done the same thing too (^_^)

messages.subject: Re: Sound of Laughter
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.shinsengumihq.com/spydivision.htm click on Koichi (^_^) http://www.shinsengumihq.com/otherficindex.htm just another thought the other reason why I
messages.messageBody:
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/spydivision.htm
click on Koichi (^_^)
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/otherficindex.htm

just another thought
the other reason why I wrote this story is difference of 1 month
between the birth of MInoru, the grandson, and the death of Motoko
the granddaughter...so the household was pretty stressed out

*I clearly read on a board that Tsutomu continued to live in Bunkyo
in close proximity to his parents once he married Midori...he moves
away a couple of decades down the line probably after Tokio died
I can't imagine him leaving his mother alone for the 5 years after
F.G. died

*after Midori graduated from Tokio's school she was a teacher...some
translations say science teacher, but again it is nifty, so it would
make sense if she found employment at the school or nearby
institution

I did keep double checking on the Japanese sites Motoko was born Sept
28 and Fujita Goro died on Sept 28 it is a coincidence of numbers
**there are very old Chinese beliefs regarding death/birthday
date "clashes"...this may be related to why once a person dies their
deathday and not birthday is celebrated...nonetheless they are linked

although I don't check my horoscope everyday I think it is great fun
to compare horoscopes between characters and form their personalities
Motoko, year of the rooster (2005=year of the rooster) and Fujita
Goro, year of the Dragon combination is interesting. Roosters are
more outgoing and would be more attracted to quiet and reserved
Dragons.

messages.subject: Re: Sound of Laughter + Fanart Contest Update
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks.  I will be revising the story slightly because I had wanted to use more stronger terms.  After revising and catching typos like cloth/clothe (^_^) I
messages.messageBody:
Thanks. I will be revising the story slightly because I had wanted
to use more stronger terms. After revising and catching typos like
cloth/clothe (^_^) I will upload it to SHQ.com in the fanfic section
and delete the rough draft in the "Files" section here

secretarytocapt3

messages.subject: Re: Sound of Laughter + Fanart Contest Update
messages.msgSnippet: Writing children are really interesting... I must agree though that there is that barrier when they turn evil... ^__^ Just kidding... But yes I tend to agree 3
messages.messageBody:
Writing children are really interesting... I must agree though that
there is that barrier when they turn evil... ^__^ Just kidding... But
yes I tend to agree 3 below are very cute and lovable while those
older 4 above start being a little mischievous.

And I like how you can write short stories and get the point across.

~Kizu

messages.subject: Re: Sound of Laughter + Fanart Contest Update
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you Barb(^_^) I wrote the story because I always wondered how children think . From interacting with my niece it is clear that children at that age are
messages.messageBody:
Thank you Barb(^_^)
I wrote the story because I always wondered how children "think".
From interacting with my niece it is clear that children at that age
are very intelligent and have outstanding memories even when they are
only 2 years old....when they turn 4 they generally become *evil*.

[correction to the story] I was writing it on the bus and must've
scribbled Feb 1 instead of Feb 9...Fujita Minoru was actually born
Feb 9 (oops, sorry)
------------------------------------
2nd entry has been submitted for the Fanart Contest
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/ "Girls of the Shinsengumi Contest"
comments for the entries may be posted at
http://www.shinsengumimb.com look under "fanart"

from all the Instant Messages and emails I've been receiving I think
we will have considerably MORE submissions than the uniform contest
(which means that Moeyoken is actually a GOOD commercial idea)...the
prize, the Shinsengumi tenugui has arrived today and it is AWESOME!!!!

If I DO get MANY submissions I may add minor prizes (so don't worry).

secretarytocapt3
(feeling RICH after getting federal tax return)
